The creature is free from the enchantment if it takes any damage. Each hour passed dancing, the creature gains one level of {@condition exhaustion}. A {@condition charmed} target can repeat the saving throw each hour, with disadvantage if the wraith is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the nightwraith's Moonlight Dance for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
entries: The wraith takes 5 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Life Drain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}28 ({@damage 5d8 + 5}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction last until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Deathly Projection (2/Day)
entries: The wraith creates 3 ({@dice 1d4 + 1}) duplicates specter of itself that appear in an unoccupied spaces within 30 feet of it. It can also turn {@condition invisible} until it attacks, either before or after it creates the specters. The wraith regains hit points equal to the damage inflicted by the specters.

monster.name: Noonwraith

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The wraith can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Midday Dance
entries: Each creature within 60 feet of the wraith that can see it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition charmed}, joining the wraith in its maddening dance. The creature is free from the enchantment if it takes any damage. Each hour passed dancing, the creature gains one level of {@condition exhaustion}. A {@condition charmed} target can repeat the saving throw each hour, with disadvantage if the wraith is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the noonwraith's Midday Dance for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Moonlight Sensitivity
entries: At night, the wraith has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Life Drain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}28 ({@damage 5d8 + 5}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken and the wraith regains hit points equal to that amount. This reduction last until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Searing Heat (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The wraith wraps heat and dust around her. Every creature within 20 feet of the wraith must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 6d6}) fire damage on a failed save and being {@condition blinded} until the end of their next turn. Creatures take half as much damage on a successful saving throw and are not {@condition blinded}.

monster.name: Oracula

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Catoptric Travel
entries: When the wraith is within 5 feet of a reflective surface that it can see, it can use a bonus action to shift to the Material Plane, the Ethereal Plane, or its demiplane. When it would enter the Ethereal Plane, it can instead immediately appear in front of a different reflective surface that it can see in the Material Plane if that mirror is within 60 feet of it.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The wraith can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Mirror Bound
entries: On the Material Plane, the wraith can only move within the span of reflection of reflective surfaces, such as mirrors, still pools, and polished steel, that are at least a square foot. If it is more than 30 feet away from any such surface, the wraith immediately shifts to the Ethereal Plane.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wraith can use its Eye Bleed and makes two mirror shard attacks.

action.name: Mirror Shard
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 4d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Eye Bleed
entries: The wraith targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the wraith's eyes, the target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw against this magic or take 22 ({@damage 4d10}) necrotic damage and be permanently {@condition blinded}.

legendary.name: Fly
entries: The wraith flies up to half its flying speed.

legendary.name: Prison of Mirrors (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Every creature the wraith can see within 30 feet of a mirror at least 4 feet tall must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw or be magically shifted to the wraith's demiplane.

legendary.name: Death Omen (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The wraith targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be magically cursed. Until the curse ends, the target is affected as if by the enemies abound spell, seeing all creatures as threatening undead. In addition, the target dies if it drops to 0 hit points. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the curse on a success.

monster.name: Pesta

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Deceitful Mask
entries: As a bonus action, the wraith can mask its appearance and appear to be any kind of ghost, specter or wraith. In addition, the wraith changes the way it appears to spells and magical effects that detect creature types, such as a paladin's Divine Sense. It chooses a creature type and other spells and magical effects treat it as if it were a creature of that type or of that alignment. This magical illusion lasts until it ends it as a bonus action. The effect also ends if the wraith drops to 50 hit points or fewer, or if dispel magic is cast on it.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The wraith can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The wraith regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point. If the wraith takes radiant damage this trait doesn't function at the start of the wraith's next turn.

trait.name: Supernatural Plague
entries: The wraith contains all diseases that ever existed, aggravated by its nature. All are magical diseases and affect creatures immune to nonmagical disease. A lesser restoration spell or similar magic casted on a creature affected with a disease of the wraith can remove it only if the caster succeeds on a DC 15 ability check using its spellcasting ability.

action.name: Plague Caress
entries: The wraith targets one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the target fails the saving throw, its hit point maximum is reduced for 1 hour by an amount equal to the necrotic damage it took. Any effect that removes a disease allows a creature's hit point maximum to return to normal before that time passes.

action.name: Pestilential Breath (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The wraith exhales a 60-foot cone of flies and noxious gas. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or take 56 ({@damage 16d6}) poison damage and be infected with a disease. This plague ravages an infected creature's body, killing the creature in a number of hours equal to {@dice 1d12} + the creature's Constitution score, unless the disease is removed. On a successful save, a creature takes half the poison damage and isn't diseased.

legendary.name: Affliction
entries: The wraith targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it that is infected with a disease. The target must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage. A humanoid slain by this attack rises as an undead at the start of its next turn. If the victim had 2 or fewer Hit Dice, it becomes a zombie. If it had 3 Hit Dice or more, it becomes a rotfiend.

legendary.name: Flare-Up Disease
entries: The wraith targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it that is infected with a disease. The target has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws until the end of its next turn.

legendary.name: Vermin Cloud (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The wraith releases a cloud of insects that fills a 15-foot·radius sphere centered on itself. The cloud lingers until the end of the wraith's next turn. The cloud is opaque. Any creature in the cloud when it appears, or that enters it later, must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 24 hours.

monster.name: Shade

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The shade can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Negative Energy Aura
entries: Creatures within 5 feet of the shade can't regain hit points.

trait.name: Shadow Shroud
entries: As a bonus action, the shade magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to a space it can see. It can also turn {@condition invisible} until it attacks, either before or after it teleports. If the shade takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function until the end of the shade's next turn.

trait.name: Shade Weaknesses
entries: The shade has the following flaws:

{@i Repelled by Salt} The shade can't willingly pass a line of salt by nonmagical means. If the shade tries to use teleportation to do so, it must first succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw. Whether or not the attempt is successful, the shade takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) radiant damage.
{@i Sunlight Hypersensitivity} The shade takes 5 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shade makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Annihilating Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) necrotic damage. If the shade had advantage on the attack roll, the attack deals an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage.

monster.name: Shade Host
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Incorporeal Swarm
entries: The shade host can occupy another creature's space and vice versa; it can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. Each creature it moves through takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) necrotic damage; no creature can take this damage more than once per turn. The shade host takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object. The shade host can't gain temporary hit points.

trait.name: Howling Hatred
entries: The shade host emits a horrific howl while it can see any living creature and isn't {@condition incapacitated}. Each creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the shade host and can hear the howl must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn.

While {@condition frightened} in this way, the creature rolls a {@dice d8} to determine what it does during its turn. On a 1 to 4, the creature drops whatever it is holding and must move at least 30 feet away from the shade host, if able. On a 5 or 6, the creature is {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn. On a 7 or 8, the creature is overwhelmed with despair until the start of its next turn. During this time, it can't attack or target any creature with harmful abilities, spells, or other magical effects.

trait.name: Negative Energy Aura
entries: Creatures within 5 feet of the shade host can't regain hit points.

trait.name: Shade Host Weaknesses
entries: The shade host has the following flaws:
{@i Repelled by Salt} The shade host can't willingly pass a line of salt by nonmagical means.
{@i Sunlight Hypersensitivity} The shade host takes 5 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shade host makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Annihilating Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 4d8 + 3}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Create Specter
entries: The shade host targets a humanoid within its space that has been dead for no longer than 1 minute and died violently. The target's spirit rises as a specter that becomes part of the shade host, the shade host regains 22 ({@dice 5d8}) hit points. While the specter is part of the shade host, the dead humanoid it came from can't be revived.

monster.name: Bloated Zombie
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: When the zombie is destroyed, it explodes in a burst of acid and guts. Each creature within 10 feet of it must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage.

action.name: Spew Bile (recharge 5-6)
entries: The zombie spews bile in 15-foot line. Each creature in that line must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.name: Feral Zombie
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the zombie can move up to half its speed toward a hostile creature it can see.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

monster.name: Horde of Zombies
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Plagued
entries: When the swarm hits with an attack, it deals an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Medium humanoid. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

trait.name: Undead Swarm Fortitude
entries: The swarm fights at full strength until it is completely destroyed.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The horde uses its pull under ability if able, then uses its gnaw and claw attack.

action.name: Gnaw and Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage, and the target must succeed a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} until the end of their next turn.

action.name: Pull Under
entries: The horde attempts to envelope a creature within its space. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and considered {@condition grappled} (escape DC 13) as they are pinned to the ground under a sea of zombies. This ability can only be used if the horde is above half of its maximum hit points.

monster.name: Ravenous Zombie
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The zombie has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Herald of Decay
entries: All food and liquid within 60 feet of the zombie spoils instantly. Rations turn bad, meat rots, bread becomes stale and water becomes unsafe to drink. Small nonmagical plants wither and die, while trees become sick and start to rot. Perishables protected by air-sealed containers are unaffected.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Voracious Aura
entries: Any living creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the zombie or enters the affected area for the first time on a turn must succeed a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target's hit point maximum is reduced by 7 ({@dice 2d6}), and the zombie regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The zombie makes two unarmed strike attacks and one bite attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. Instead of dealing damage, the zombie can grapple the target (escape DC 14).

action.name: Devour
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature that is {@condition grappled} by the zombie, {@condition incapacitated} or {@condition restrained}. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d8 + 4}) piercing damage. A creature taking damage from the attack suffers from a lingering injury (p.272 of the Dungeon Master's Guide).

trait.name: Hive Mind
entries: All zombies within 5 miles of the shambling lord are tied into an instinctive hive mind, linked to the lord. Within the range of the telepathic bond, the shambling lord can see through the eyes of any zombie, hear what it hears and speak through it. It can cast spells as though it were in the zombie's space, and can mentally command any zombie within reach (if it controls multiple creatures, it can command any or all of them at the same time, issuing the same command to each one).

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The shambling lord has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The zombie regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn. If the zombie takes radiant damage or a critical hit, this trait doesn't function at the start of the zombie's next turn. The shambling lord is destroyed only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Well of Knowledge
entries: The shambling lord can recollect all the knowledges and memories stored in the collective hive mind of its hordes or the brains it devoured. It has advantage on Intelligence and Wisdom skill checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shambling lord uses its Shambling Hordes feature, if available, and makes two unarmed strike attacks and one bite attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage 17 ({@damage 5d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Psychic Assault
entries: The shambling lord magically assault the mind of three targets it can see within 90 feet of it. A target must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also {@condition stunned} until the end of the zombie's next turn.

action.name: Shambling Hordes (recharge 5-6)
entries: The shambling lord can summon one horde of zombies, a summoned horde appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of the shambling lord, acting as an ally. It remains for l minute, until it or the shambling lord dies, or until the shambling lord dismisses it as an action.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The shambling lord's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 16). The zombie can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Medium humanoid. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The swarm makes two improvised weapons attacks.

action.name: Improvised Weapons
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 0 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target in the swarm's space or within range. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) bludeoning damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage, or 7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

entries.name: Frenzied
entries: If the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer at the start of its turn, roll a d6. On a roll of 5 or 6, the swarm uses its action to make a melee attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach. If there is no creature within its reach, the swarm does nothing this turn.

entries.name: Sacrifice
entries: When the swarm hits a Medium or smaller target with a melee weapon attack, it is {@condition grappled} (escape DC 13). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, the swarm can automatically hit the target with its melee weapon attacks. The target dies if reduced to 0 hit points while {@condition grappled} by the swarm.

entries.name: Open the Gate
entries: The swarm reduces itself to 0 hit points, summoning a fiend or aberration creature of challenge rating equal to its own or lower, or half of its challenge rating (rounded up) if it has half of its hit points or fewer. The creature appears in an unoccupied space within the swarm's space. The summoned creature disappears when it drops to 0 hit points.

entries.name: Bad Omens
entries: If the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer at the start of its turn, roll a d6. On a roll of 5 or 6, the swarm has a speed of 0 and has disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls until the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Burn the Heretics
entries: While inside the swarm's space, any creature that tries to cast a spell must avoid the wrath of the fanatics. The creature can choose another action, but if it tries to cast the spell, it must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 1d6 fire damage per level of the spell, and the spell has no effect and is wasted.

entries.name: Purified by Fire
entries: When the swarm hits with any weapon, if the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 5 (1d10) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

entries.name: Reactive
entries: The swarm can take one reaction on every turn in a combat.

entries.name: Unruly
entries: If the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer at the start of its turn, roll a d6. On a roll of 5 or 6, the swarm uses up all its movement to move in a random direction. To determine the direction, roll a d8 and assign a direction to each die face. The swarm doesn't take an action this turn.

entries.name: Countercharge
entries: In response to a creature entering its reach, the swarm can make one melee weapon attack with advantage against the creature.

entries.name: Impetuous
entries: If the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer at the start of its turn, roll a d6. On a roll of 5 or 6, the swarm uses up all its movement to move toward the nearest and most obvious seat of power. The swarm moves toward the seat of power by the most direct route.

entries.name: Sworn Enemy
entries: The swarm has a sworn enemy, which include every identified member of an organization or government. When the swarm makes a melee or ranged attack roll against its sworn enemy, it has advantage on the roll. In addition, its target gains no benefit from cover, other than total cover. If the attack hits, the sworn enemy takes an extra 10 (3d6) damage.

entries: The swarm deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 0 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target in the swarm's space or within range. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludeoning damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage, or 10 ({@damage 3d6}) bludgeoning damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

entries.name: Frenzied
entries: If the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer at the start of its turn, roll a d6. On a roll of 5 or 6, the swarm uses its action to make a melee attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach. If there is no creature within its reach, the swarm does nothing this turn.

entries.name: Sacrifice
entries: When the swarm hits a Medium or smaller target with a melee weapon attack, it is {@condition grappled} (escape DC 13). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, the swarm can automatically hit the target with its melee weapon attacks. The target dies if reduced to 0 hit points while {@condition grappled} by the swarm.

entries.name: Open the Gate
entries: The swarm reduces itself to 0 hit points, summoning a fiend or aberration creature of challenge rating equal to its own or lower, or half of its challenge rating (rounded up) if it has half of its hit points or fewer. The creature appears in an unoccupied space within the swarm's space. The summoned creature disappears when it drops to 0 hit points.

entries.name: Bad Omens
entries: If the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer at the start of its turn, roll a d6. On a roll of 5 or 6, the swarm has a speed of 0 and has disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls until the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Burn the Heretics
entries: While inside the swarm's space, any creature that tries to cast a spell must avoid the wrath of the fanatics. The creature can choose another action, but if it tries to cast the spell, it must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 1d6 fire damage per level of the spell, and the spell has no effect and is wasted.

entries.name: Purified by Fire
entries: When the swarm hits with any weapon, if the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 5 (1d10) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

entries.name: Reactive
entries: The swarm can take one reaction on every turn in a combat.

entries.name: Unruly
entries: If the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer at the start of its turn, roll a d6. On a roll of 5 or 6, the swarm uses up all its movement to move in a random direction. To determine the direction, roll a d8 and assign a direction to each die face. The swarm doesn't take an action this turn.

entries.name: Countercharge
entries: In response to a creature entering its reach, the swarm can make one melee weapon attack with advantage against the creature.

entries.name: Impetuous
entries: If the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer at the start of its turn, roll a d6. On a roll of 5 or 6, the swarm uses up all its movement to move toward the nearest and most obvious seat of power. The swarm moves toward the seat of power by the most direct route.

entries.name: Sworn Enemy
entries: The swarm has a sworn enemy, which include every identified member of an organization or government. When the swarm makes a melee or ranged attack roll against its sworn enemy, it has advantage on the roll. In addition, its target gains no benefit from cover, other than total cover. If the attack hits, the sworn enemy takes an extra 10 (3d6) damage.

entries.name: Destructive
entries: The swarm deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Inspirational Ideals (Recharge 4-6}
entries: Up to three allies within 120 feet of the swarm that can hear it can use their reactions to be freed from any charm and fright effect.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the berserker hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Islander's Fortitude (2/Day)
entries: If damage reduces the berserker to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is from a critical hit. On a success, the berserker drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Mariner
entries: The berserker can hold its breath underwater for twice as long and has proficiency with navigator's tools. The berserker is also naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the berserker is wearing no armor, its AC includes its Constitution modifier.

trait.name: Unbridled Rage (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the berserker can enter a rage at the start of its turn. The rage lasts for 1 minute or until the berserker is {@condition incapacitated}. While raging, the berserker gains the following benefits:

items: The berserker has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws
When it makes a melee weapon attack, the berserker gains a +3 bonus to the damage roll.
The berserker has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The berserker makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} para golpear, alcance 5 pies, un objetivo. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) de daño cortante.

reaction.name: Retaliation
entries: In response to being hit by a melee attack, the berserker can make one melee weapon attack with advantage against the attacker.

reaction.name: Intimidating Presence
entries: When a creature the berserker can see starts its turn within 30 feet of the berserker, the berserker can intimidate it. If the creature can see the berserker, it must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of berserker's next turn.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The warrior has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Mariner
entries: The warrior can hold its breath underwater for twice as long and has proficiency with navigator's tools. The warrior is also naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the warrior can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The warrior makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d12 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Boarding Harpoon
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape DC 12) and pulled 10 feet toward the warrior. If this bring the {@condition grappled} creature within 5 feet of the warrior, the warrior can make a melee weapon attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the huskarl hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Deadly Strike (1/Turn)
entries: Any hit with a melee weapon attack the huskarl scores against a {@condition prone} creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Indomitable (2/Day)
entries: The huskarl can reroll a saving throw it fails. It must use the new roll.

trait.name: Mariner
entries: The huskarl can hold its breath underwater for twice as long and has proficiency with navigator's tools. The huskarl is also naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The huskarl makes either three melee attacks two with its longsword and one with its spiked shield or two ranged attacks with its longbow.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} para golpear, alcance 5 pies, un objetivo. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) de daño cortante.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Spiked Shield
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

reaction.name: Bulwark
entries: When an ally the huskarl can see within 5 feet of it is attacked, the huskarl switches places with the ally. The two ally swap places, and the huskarl becomes the target instead.

trait.name: First Axe
entries: A weapon deals two extra dice of its damage when the jarl hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Mariner
entries: The jarl can hold its breath underwater for twice as long and has proficiency with navigator's tools. The jarl is also naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

trait.name: Survivor
entries: The jarl regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point but fewer hit points than half its hit point maximum.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The jarl makes three melee attacks or three ranged attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) slashing damage. If the jarl scores a critical hit, it rolls the damage dice three times, instead of twice.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The jarl adds 5 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the jarl must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

legendary.name: Encourage
entries: The jarl encourages one ally it can see within 60 feet of it. The ally has advantage on attack rolls it makes until the start of the jarl's next turn, provided it can hear the jarl.

legendary.name: Deathblow (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The jarl makes one weapon attack. If it hits, the attack deals maximum damage and the target can't regain hit points until the end of its next turn.

legendary.name: Unleash the Fury (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Up to three friendly creature within 120 feet of the jarl that can hear it can use their reactions to move up to their speed and each make one weapon attack.

trait.name: Mariner
entries: The raider can hold its breath underwater for twice as long and has proficiency with navigator's tools. The northlander is also naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

action.name: Battleaxe or Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) slashing damage if wielded with two hands.

action.name: Handaxe
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Wall of Shields
entries: When the raider is within 5 feet of a creature that has the Mariner trait and is bearing a shield, it can use their reaction to make a wall of shields. The involved raider and creature gain half cover, provided they are bearing a shield.

trait.name: Lightfooted
entries: The maiden can take the Dash or Disengage action as a bonus action on each of her turns.

trait.name: Mariner
entries: The maiden can hold her breath underwater for twice as long and has proficiency with navigator's tools. The maiden is also naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The maiden makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Counterattack
entries: When a creature misses the maiden with a melee weapon attack, the maiden can make one melee weapon attack with advantage against the creature.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The skald has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Mariner
entries: The skald can hold its breath underwater for twice as long and has proficiency with navigator's tools. The skald is also naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

trait.name: Shout of Valor (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The skald can utter a powerful warcry. For 1 minute, whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a damage roll. The creature can add a {@dice d6} to its roll provided it can hear and understand the skald. A creature can benefit from only one Shout of Valor die at a time. This effect ends if the skald is {@condition incapacitated} or {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The skald makes two melee attacks or two ranged attack.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: War Horn (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The skald blows in its horn. Each hostile creature within 120 feet of the skald that can hear it must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of the skald's next turn or until the skald is {@condition incapacitated}. A {@condition frightened} target that starts its turn within 30 feet of the skald must use all its movement on that turn to get as far from the skald as possible, must finish the move before taking an action, and must take the safest available route away from the skald. A target that successfully saves is immune to the War Horn of all skalds for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the thane hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Indomitable (3/Day)
entries: The thane can reroll a saving throw it fails. It must use the new roll.

trait.name: Mariner
entries: The thane can hold its breath underwater for twice as long and has proficiency with navigator's tools. The thane is also naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

trait.name: Martial Superiority (1/Turn)
entries: The thane can deal an extra 17 ({@dice 5d6}) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the thane can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The thane makes three melee attacks: one with its battleaxe and two with its longsword.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage and the target must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage. If the thane scores a critical hit, it rolls the damage dice three times, instead of twice.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The thane makes one longsword attack.

legendary.name: Command Ally
entries: The thane targets one ally it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see and hear the thane, the target can move up to its speed as a reaction.

legendary.name: Inspire Ally
entries: The thane targets one ally it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see and hear the thane, the creature gains 20 temporary hit points.

legendary.name: Rally Ally
entries: The thane targets one ally it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see and hear the thane, it is freed from any charm and fright effect.

legendary.name: Rush (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The thane moves up to its speed to a creature it can see and slams into it. The target must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the heir can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Ancestor's Protection
entries: The heir has advantage on saving throws against any spell that targets only the heir. If the heir's saving throw succeeds and the spell is of 7th level or lower, the heir is unaffected, and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from the heir, turning the caster into the target.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the heir hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The heir's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Mariner
entries: The heir can hold its breath underwater for twice as long and has proficiency with navigator's tools. The heir is also naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the heir is wearing no armor, its AC includes its Constitution modifier.

trait.name: Unbridled Rage
entries: As a bonus action, the heir can enter a rage at the start of its turn. The rage lasts until the heir is {@condition incapacitated} or choose to end it. While raging, the heir gains the following benefits:

items: The heir has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.
When it makes a melee weapon attack, the heir gains a +4 bonus to the damage roll.
The heir has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The heir makes two melee attacks or four melee attacks if it has fewer than half of its hit points remaining. On a hit, the heir can cause an additional effect, choosing from the options below (each effect can be used only once per turn):
The attack deals an extra 18 ({@damage 4d8}) slashing damage.
The target must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of the northlander's next turn.
The attack bypass the damage resistances of the target.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 2d12 + 7}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Lore Keeper
entries: The völva has advantage on Intelligence and Wisdom ability checks.

trait.name: Mariner
entries: The völva can hold her breath underwater for twice as long and has proficiency with navigator's tools. The völva is also naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

trait.name: Seeress
entries: The völva can't be surprised and attack rolls against her have disadvantage unless the völva is {@condition incapacitated} or {@condition restrained}. While the völva is wearing no armor, her AC includes her Wisdom modifier.

trait.name: Wand-Wed
entries: The völva carries a staff carved out of the wood of a mystical white tree, that is a focus for her inner power. She can use the staff as if it were a staff of healing (Wisdom spellcasting ability). If the staff is lost or destroyed, the völva must craft another, which takes a year and a day. Only a völva can use the staff.

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 (l{@dice d6 - 1}) bludgeoning damage, or 3 (l{@dice d8 - 1}) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Tormenting Vision
entries: The völva targets one creature she can see within 60 feet of her. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the target is under one of the following effects, chosen by the völva:

items: The target takes 16 ({@damage 3d10}) psychic damage and is {@condition frightened} until the end of the völva's next turn.

On its turn, the target can't move, and it uses its action to make a melee or ranged attack against a randomly determined creature within range. If the target can't attack, it does nothing on its turn.
The target is {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

trait.name: The King in Green (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the king can enter a blessed state at the start of his turn. The blessing lasts for 1 minute or until the king is {@condition incapacitated}. While blessed, the king gains the following benefits:

items: The king sheds bright green light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. Any creature in the area of the light can't benefit from being {@condition invisible}.
The king has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
When the king makes a Charisma or Strength check, he can replace the number he rolls with a 15.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If the king fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Weapon Mastery
entries: When the king hits with a melee weapon, it deals one extra die of the weapon's damage, plus an additional 6 damage (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The king makes three solais attacks.

action.name: Solais
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d6 + 13}) slashing damage. Solais is a +3 silvered magic weapon.

action.name: Blessed Fury (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The king uses Multiattack. Each attack that hits deals an extra 9 ({@dice 2d8}) damage of the following types (king's choice): lightning, radiant, or thunder.

reaction.name: Goddess' Protection
entries: In response to being hit by an attack, the king reduces the damage to 0 and each creature within 5 feet of the king takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) radiant damage.

legendary.name: King's Blessing
entries: The king bestows his blessing on one ally he can see within 30 feet of him. The ally has advantage on attack rolls and saving throws it makes until the start of the king's next turn.

legendary.name: Imperious Blow (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The king makes a Solais attack. If it hits, the target must succeed on a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of the king until the end of its next turn.

legendary.name: Word of Peace (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The king speaks with the voice of the goddess. Each creature within 30 feet of the king that can hear him must succeed on a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} for an hour. While {@condition charmed} by the king, a creature becomes indifferent about creatures that it is hostile toward. A creature is no longer {@condition charmed} if it is attacked or harmed by a spell or if it witnesses any of its friends being harmed. When the effect ends, the creature becomes hostile again, unless the DM rules otherwise. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the king's Word of Peace for the next 24 hours.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The druid is a 11th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 15, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric and druid spells prepared:
footerEntries: 1st Level (4 slots): animal friendship, cure wounds
2nd Level (3 slots): healing spirit, spiritual weapon
3rd Level (3 slots): erupting earth, spirit guardians
5th Level (2 slots): commune, wrath of nature
6th Level (1 slot): conjure fey, druid grove

trait.name: Fey-Touched
entries: The druid can tell if an object or a creature it touches is magical, and if that magic originated from a fey creature. The druid also has advantage on Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks.

trait.name: Spirit Shape
entries: As a bonus action, the druid can magically shift to the Ethereal Plane. At the start of its next turn, it returns to the Material Plane in an unoccupied space that it can see within 30 feet of the space it vanished from.

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage, or 4 ({@damage 1d8}) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Brand of the Prey
entries: The druid targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be magically cursed. Until the curse ends, beast, fey, and plant creatures are hostile to the target and have advantage on attack rolls made against it. The curse lasts until removed by the remove curse spell or other magic.

trait.name: Fey-Touched
entries: The fianna can tell if an object or a creature it touches is magical, and if that magic originated from a fey creature. The fianna also has advantage on Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks.

trait.name: Harrier
entries: When the fianna makes a melee attack against a creature, it doesn't provoke opportunity attacks from that creature for the rest of the turn, whether it hits or not.

trait.name: Opportunist
entries: The fianna deals an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage when it hits a target with an opportunity attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The fianna makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage, or 5 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage and the target's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Artisan
entries: The islander has proficiency with one type of artisan's tools of its choice.

trait.name: Fey-Touched
entries: The islander can tell if an object or a creature it touches is magical, and if that magic originated from a fey creature. The islander also has advantage on Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks.

trait.name: War Hound
entries: As a bonus action, the islander can command an ally {@creature mastiff} that can hear it to use its reaction to move up to its speed and make one bite attack.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage, or 5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Sling
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Channel Aspect
entries: As a bonus action at the start of its turn, the leathdhia can magically channel an aspect of the goddess. The aspect lasts until the leathdhia is {@condition incapacitated}, channels another aspect, or chooses to end it. While channeling, the leathdhia gains one of the following benefits of its choice:

trait.name: Badb
entries: A creature dies if reduced to 0 hit points by the leathdhia.

trait.name: Da Dhiogail
entries: Attack rolls against the leathdhia have disadvantage, unless the leathdhia is {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Earthmother
entries: The leathdhia can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. Each creature it moves through takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) radiant damage; no creature can take this damage more than once per turn. The leathdhia takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Divine Conduit
entries: The leathdhia can cast commune at will. Its spellcasting ability for it is Charisma.

trait.name: Threefold Death
entries: If damage reduces the leathdhia to 0 hit points, the leathdhia drops to 1 hit point instead. If the leathdhia is reduced to 0 hit points three times on the same turn, this trait doesn't function.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The leathdhia makes two attacks.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Storm of War (Badb Aspect Only)
entries: The leathdhia creates bolts of lightning, which can strike up to three targets the leathdhia can see within 120 feet of it. A target must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The leathdhia makes one attack.

legendary.name: Silver Mist (Earthmother Aspect Only)
entries: A silvery mist conceals the leathdhia, turning it {@condition invisible} until it attacks. While {@condition invisible}, the leathdhia has resistance to all damage.

legendary.name: Cursed Wail (Da Dhiogail Aspect Only, Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The leathdhia releases a blood-curling wail. Each creature hostile to the leathdhia within 30 feet of it that can hear it must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or be cursed. Until the curse ends, the target has vulnerability to all damage. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the curse on itself on a success.

legendary.name: Ocean's Roar (Badb Aspect Only, Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The leathdhia spews out a wave of water. The wave can be up to 30 feet long, up to 10 feet wide, and up to 10 feet tall. Each creature in that area must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 36 ({@damage 8d8}) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}. The water then spreads out across the ground in all directions, extinguishing unprotected flames in its area and within 30 feet of it, and then vanishes.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the macnia hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Exemplary
entries: A macnia's allied creature can't be {@condition frightened} while it can see the macnia within 30 feet of it.

trait.name: Fey-Touched
entries: The macnia can tell if an object or a creature it touches is magical, and if that magic originated from a fey creature. The macnia also has advantage on Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks.

trait.name: Quickening
entries: As a bonus action, the macnia can add {@dice 1d10} to its next attack or damage roll with a greatsword.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The macnia makes three greatsword attacks or three longbow attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Duelist
entries: The macnia adds {@dice 1d10} to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the macnia must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon. If the attack misses as a result, the macnia can make one melee weapon attack with advantage against the creature.

trait.name: Fey-Touched
entries: The noble can tell if an object or a creature it touches is magical, and if that magic originated from a fey creature. The noble also has advantage on Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks.

trait.name: Might of the Goddess
entries: Once per turn, the noble can deal an extra 22 ({@dice 5d8}) damage of one of the following types (noble's choice) to a creature it hits with a melee weapon attack: lightning, radiant, or thunder.

trait.name: Weapon Mastery
entries: When the noble hits with a melee weapon, it deals one extra die of the weapon's damage, plus an additional 4 damage (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The noble makes three oathblade attacks.

action.name: Oathblade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d8 + 8}) slashing damage, or 19 ({@damage 2d10 + 8}) slashing damage if used with two hands. The oathblade is a silvered magic weapon.

reaction.name: Goddess' Presence
entries: The noble grants advantage to a saving throw made by itself or another creature that it can see within 30 feet of it. The noble can make this choice after the roll is made but before it succeeds or fails.

trait.name: Beast Bond
entries: The ranger can cast beast bond at will, requiring no components. Its spellcasting ability for it is Wisdom.

trait.name: Fey-Touched
entries: The ranger can tell if an object or a creature it touches is magical, and if that magic originated from a fey creature. The ranger also has advantage on Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ranger makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or take 11 ({@damage 2d10}) poison damage and become {@condition poisoned}. While {@condition poisoned}, the target is unable to breath. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each minute that elapses, ending the effect on itself on a success.

reaction.name: Skirmisher
entries: The ranger moves up to half its speed when an enemy ends its turn within 5 feet of it. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

trait.name: Demented Rage (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the fury can enter a rage at the start of its turn. The rage lasts for 1 minute or until the fury is {@condition incapacitated}. While raging, the fury gains the following benefits:

items: The speed of the fury increases by 30 feet and it doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.
Attack rolls against the fury have disadvantage, unless the fury is {@condition incapacitated}.
When it makes a melee weapon attack, the fury gains a +3 bonus to the damage roll.

trait.name: Merciless
entries: The fury has advantage on melee attack rolls against a {@condition frightened} creature.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the fury is wearing no armor, its AC includes its Constitution modifier.

trait.name: Wailing Charge
entries: If the fury moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target, and then hits that target with a melee weapon attack, the target is {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The fury makes two longsword attacks, or four longsword attacks if it has fewer than half of its hit points remaining. If Cursed Wail is available to use, the fury can use it before or after these attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) poison damage.

action.name: Cursed Wail (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The fury releases a bloodcurling wail. Each creature hostile to the fury within 30 feet of it that can hear it must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or be cursed. Until the curse ends, the target has vulnerability to all damage. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the curse on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the curse ends for it, the creature is immune to the fury's Wail for the next 24 hours.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The druid is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 13, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric and druid spells prepared:
footerEntries: 2nd Level (3 slots): hold person, scorching ray
3rd Level (3 slots): call lightning, tidal wave

trait.name: Fey-Touched
entries: The druid can tell if an object or a creature it touches is magical, and if that magic originated from a fey creature. The druid also has advantage on Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks.

trait.name: Litany of War
entries: When the druid uses its action to cast a spell or take the Attack action, it generates 1 shared legendary action for the Garden of Badb (see Garden of Badb sidebar).

trait.name: War Magic
entries: When the druid uses its action to cast a spell, it can make one weapon attack as a bonus action.

trait.name: Woad War Paint
entries: When the druid is reduced to 0 hit points, reduces a hostile creature to 0 hit points or scores a critical hit, it generates 1 shared legendary action for the Garden of Badb (see Garden of Badb sidebar).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The druid makes two greataxe attacks.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d12 + 3}) slashing damage.

variant.name: Garden of Badb
entries: Badb is war and war is Badb. When the enemy's blood flows in her name, the goddess takes notice and reward her warriors with exalted powers, turning them into her instrument of destruction. Creatures that have the {@b Woad War Paint trait} (refered as painted for this sidebar) can take the following legendary actions:

entries.name: Shared Legendary Actions
entries: Painted can take legendary actions, choosing from the options below, but must share the actions among themselves. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Legendary actions are only available if a creature generates one with a power and are all lost at the end of the combat encounter.

entries.name: Goddess' Guidance
entries: The painted makes a melee weapon attack with advantage. If it hits, the painted gains temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt.

entries.name: Exalted
entries: The painted can magically end the {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened} conditions on itself and each creature of its choice that it can see within 30 feet of it.

entries.name: Flock of Doom (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The painted summons one primal murder of crows, which appears within 30 feet of it in an unoccupied space it can see. The swarm obeys its summoner's commands and can't be controlled by any other creature. The swarm vanishes when it drops to 0 hit points.

entries.name: Mist of the Isles (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The painted and each creatures of its choice that it can see within 30 feet of it magically turn {@condition invisible} until the end of the painted's next turn.

entries.name: Shroud of Badb (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The painted is immune to all damage and conditions until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: War is Eternal (Cost 3 Actions)
entries: The painted targets one dead humanoid that has died within the last round it can see within 30 feet of it. The target is revived with all its hit points.

trait.name: Fey-Touched
entries: The reaver can tell if an object or a creature it touches is magical, and if that magic originated from a fey creature. The reaver also has advantage on Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks.

trait.name: Reckless Charge
entries: If the reaver moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target, it has advantage on its next melee weapon attack roll against that target.

trait.name: Woad War Paint
entries: When the reaver is reduced to 0 hit points, reduces a hostile creature to 0 hit points or scores a critical hit, it generates 1 shared legendary action for the Garden of Badb (see Garden of Badb sidebar).

action.name: Battleaxe or Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage if wielded with two hands.

action.name: Handaxe
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the whaler hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Fey-Touched
entries: The whaler can tell if an object or a creature it touches is magical, and if that magic originated from a fey creature. The whaler also has advantage on Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks.

trait.name: Woad War Paint
entries: When the whaler is reduced to 0 hit points, reduces a hostile creature to 0 hit points or scores a critical hit, it generates 1 shared legendary action for the Garden of Badb (see Garden of Badb sidebar).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The whaler makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Barbed Harpoon
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/100 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape DC 14). While {@condition grappled} in this way, a creature's speed isn't reduced, but it can move only in directions that bring it closer to the whaler. A creature takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) slashing damage if it escapes from the grapple or if it tries and fails. As a bonus action, the whaler can pull a creature {@condition grappled} by it 20 feet closer. The whaler can grapple only one creature at a time.

action.name: Gutting Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) slashing damage if the target is {@condition grappled} with a barbed harpoon.

trait.name: Alchemic Blood
entries: When the alkahzir takes damage of any type but psychic, each creature within 5 feet of the alkazir takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) acid damage.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the alkahzir fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Phenomenal Mithridatism
entries: After taking damage, the alkahzir gains immunity to damage of that type, except psychic damage, until the start of its next turn. If the alkahzir's takes extra damage from the Philosopher's Stone trait, this trait doesn't function until the start of the alkahzir's next turn.

trait.name: Philosopher's Stone
entries: Once per round when the alkahzir is attacked by a creature, the attacker can target the philosopher's stone trapped in it. The attacker has disadvantage on the attack roll. On a hit, the attack deals an extra 11 ({@dice 2d10}) damage to the alkahzir, and the alkahzir gains an additional action on its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The alkahzir makes two alkahest dissolution attacks.

action.name: Debilitate
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 22 Constitution saving throw or be debilitated by disease. The diseased creature can't regain hit points, and has disadvantage on Constitution saving throws.

action.name: Alkahest Dissolution
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 14} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}66 ({@damage 12d10}) acid damage. At the start of each of its turns, the target must make a DC 22 Constitution saving throw, taking 33 ({@damage 6d10}) acid damage on a failure or ending the recurring acid damage on a success. A lesser restoration spell cast on the target also ends the recurring acid damage.

action.name: Shape Materia
entries: The alkahzir performs a special alchemical procedure on one object composed entirely of wood, stone, or metal, transforming it into a different one of those materials. For each round it spends performing the procedure, it can transform 2 cubic foot of material, up to a 20-foot cube. If it concentrates on this effect for 1 minute, (as if it were concentrating on a spell), the transformation becomes permanent, otherwise the material reverts instantly to its original substance.

action.name: Aetheric Blaze (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The alkahzir agitates matter in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 22 Dexterity saving throw, taking 36 ({@damage 8d8}) fire damage and 36 ({@damage 8d8}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Debilitate
entries: The alkahzir makes one debilitate attack.

legendary.name: Azoth Transitory Shape (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The alkahzir targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 22 Constitution saving throw or be transformed for 1 minute into a gaseous, liquid, or solid form (the alkahzir's choice), unless it is a shapechanger. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the effect lasts for the full duration, the transformation becomes permanent. Only a wish spell can reverse the permanent transformation.

While transformed, the creature can't take any actions, speak, or manipulate objects. A creature's statistics, other than its speed, are unchanged. Anything it is wearing transforms with it, but nothing it is carrying does. It is immune to all nonmagical damage. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

In gaseous form, the target is weightless, has a flying speed of 20 feet, can hover, and can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the creature can do so without squeezing, and it can't pass through water.

In liquid form, the target's walking speed becomes 0, it has a swimming speed of 20 feet, and it can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can breathe air and water and can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.
In solid form, the target is {@condition petrified}.

legendary.name: Artificial Life (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The alkahzir touches the corpse of a Medium humanoid within 5 feet of it, causing it to become a flesh golem (see the Monster Manual for its stat block) for 1 hour. If the alkahzir gives the golem no commands, it does nothing but follow the alkahzir and take the Dodge action.

trait.name: Quick Quaffer
entries: The alchemist can drink a potion as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Talented Alchemist
entries: The alchemist has proficiency with alchemist's supplies and its proficiency bonus is doubled for ability checks it makes using them.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Volatile Mix
entries: The alchemist throws a flask at a solid surface within 40 feet of it, where the flask detonates. Roll a {@dice d4} or choose one of the following options:

1. Choker's Dust. Each creature within 15 feet of the flask's detonation must succeed a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or choke for 1 minute. While choking, a creature is running out of breath and can't speak or cast spells with verbal components. A choking creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

2. Devil's Puffball. Each creature within 15 feet of the flask's detonation must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 17 ({@damage 5d6}) poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition poisoned}.

3. Samum. Each creature within 15 feet of the flask's detonation must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) fire damage and is {@condition blinded} until the end of the alchemist's next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition blinded}.

4. Vitriol. Each creature within 15 feet of the flask's detonation must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) acid damage and takes 5 acid damage at the start of each of its turns. Dousing the target with water reduces the acid damage by 1 point per pint or flask of water used. If the saving throw is successful, the creature takes half as much of the initial damage and no damage at the end of its turns.

reaction.name: Smoke Bomb (Recharge 5-6)
entries: In response to taking damage, the alchemist drops a smoke bomb, releasing a cloud of smoke that fills a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on its space. The sphere is heavily obscured. Wind disperses the cloud, which otherwise lasts for 1 minute.

variant.name: Forgotten Formulas
entries: Most alchemist do not know the secrets of these formulas, but a few have rediscovered them in ancient treatises. Feel free to add some or all of them to symbolize the alchemist's progression :

entries.name: Dream Gas
entries: Each creature within 15 feet of the flask's detonation must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or fall asleep and remain {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute. A creature awakens if it takes damage or another creature takes an action to wake it.

entries.name: Ethera
entries: Each creature within 15 feet of the flask's detonation must succeed a DC 15 Charisma saving throw or gain the effect of the etherealness spell until the end of the alchemist's next turn.

entries.name: Northern Wind
entries: Each creature within 15 feet of the flask's detonation must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 22 ({@damage 4d10}) cold damage and is {@condition restrained} in ice until the end of the alchemist's next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition restrained}.

trait.name: Dermal Adaptation
entries: After taking damage, the experimenter gains resistance to damage of that type, except psychic damage, until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Inner Alchemy
entries: The numerical effects and duration of potions (such as a potion of healing or a potion of speed) used by the experimenter are doubled.

trait.name: Talented Alchemist
entries: The experimenter has proficiency with alchemist's supplies and its proficiency bonus is doubled for ability checks it makes using them.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The experimenter makes three ranged attacks or three melee attacks,

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Injector
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one creature. {@h}1 piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage. The target must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or suffer one random poison effect:
1. Poison Damage: The target takes 36 ({@damage 8d8}) poison damage.
2. Paralysis: The target is {@condition paralyzed} until the end of its next turn.

3. Organ Failure: The target is {@condition poisoned}, which causes it to also gain 1 level of {@condition exhaustion}. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the target must repeat the saving throw at the start of each of its turns. Three successful saves against the poison end it , and ending the poison removes any levels of {@condition exhaustion} caused by it. Each failed save causes the target to suffer another level of {@condition exhaustion}.

variant.name: Elixirs and Serums
entries: Experimenters come to develop their own elixirs and serums. An experimenter with Kadon's Transmogrifying Serum has a challenge rating of 11 (7,200 XP). Add some of the following ones to illustrate an experimenter's progression:

entries.name: White Raffard's Elixir (2/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, the experimenter can regain 18 ({@dice 4d8}) hit points and is freed from any disease, poison, blindness, or deafness.

entries.name: Golden Oriole Elixir (2/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, whenever the experimenter is subjected to poison damage within the next minute, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the poison damage dealt.

entries.name: Kadon's Transmogrifying Serum (1/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, the experimenter assume a muscular and hideous form for 1 hour. While transformed, the experimenter gains the following benefits:

items: Its size becomes Large.
It regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if
it has at least 1 hit point.
It has advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws.
It has a Strength of 20 (+5).
It gains the following additional action option:

entries.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10ft., one target. {@h}31 ({@damage 4d12 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If the magister fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Perfect Metal
entries: While the magister wears armor made of metal, its AC includes its Intelligence modifier.

trait.name: Talented Alchemist
entries: The magister has proficiency with alchemist's supplies and its proficiency bonus is doubled for ability checks it makes using them.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The magister makes three attacks: two with its metal shard and one with its golden phial, and uses Rust Breeze, if it is available.

action.name: Metal Shard
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Golden Phial
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one creature. {@h}36 ({@damage 8d8}) acid damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw against being {@condition petrified}. On a failed save, the creature begins to turn to gold and is {@condition restrained}. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is {@condition petrified} for 1 hour.

action.name: Rust Breeze (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The magister blows rust powder in a 15-foot cone. Each creature wearing metal armor in that area must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or take 31 ({@damage 7d8}) piercing damage and be {@condition restrained} in their armor for 1 minute.
